frameDefinitions: Blend of Rewards_and_punishments and Bodily_injury in which the Agent performs some action intended to cause Bodily harm to the Evaluee as a consequence of some action or belief of the Evaluee (the Reason).
This frame contains  words for Individuals as viewed in terms of their vocation.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.
A Defendant is tried by a Jury or Judge in a Court for Charges.

The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  '' 'We asked Ruby what kind of food they ate.'
frameExamples: The Sheriff <t>flogged</t> him for his crimes.
He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
The state will <t>try</t> him for fraud.
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
listRoleDefinitions: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the human being.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Judge</fen> heads the <fen>Court</fen> where the case is tried.  An expression referring to the <fen>Court</fen> may also stand in for the <fen>Judge</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is being tried for the <fen>Charges</fen> in <fen>Court</fen>.

This role identifies the people who are charged by the <fen>Court</fen> to listen to the testimony, evidence, and arguments, and come to a consensus about the guilt or innocence of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Charges</fen> brought against the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is tried under the laws of the <fen>Governing_authority</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the case is tried.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the case is tried.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>You</fex> will be flogged for your actions.
The Sheriff flogged him <fex>for his crimes</fex>.
<fex>Judge Murphy</fex> will try the defendant for murder.
<fex>The United States</fex> will try the accused bomber in a federal courthouse.
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the tens of billions of lire
